data.title: History Rome Foundation City Sole Rule by Mommsen Theodor
data.meta_description: A History of Rome from the Foundation of the City to the Sole Rule of Julius Caesar by Theodor Mommsen and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Quarter-Leather Hardback. Condition: Fine. Reginald Piggott (illustrator). First Thus. 2006 First Thus. Fine Quarter-Leather Hardback. No inscriptions or bookplates. Fine slipcase. Translated by W P Dickson, introduced by Anthony Grafton and edited by C J Shepherd. Complete with numerous illustrations. Bound in quarter brown leather with cloth sides blocked with an engraving by Simon Brett. Maps drawn by Reginald Piggott. Top edge gilt; internal ribbon book mark. Illustrated by Reginald Piggott. UK Postage £3.40; Airmail to USA and Canada £16.90; Airmail to most of the Rest of the World (including the EU), £16.90.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. ILLUSTRATED (illustrator). THIS IS A HEAVY VOLUME SO ADDITIONAL POSTAGE WILL BE CHARGED TO WHAT IS QUOTED ON ABE BOOKS - PLEASE ASK FOR A QUOTATION BEFORE PURCHASING TO AVOID DISAPPOINTMENT AT ADDITIONAL POSTAGE BEING ASKED FOR. xxvi + 771pp, well-illustrated, maps, bound in blue gilt decorated cloth boards with brown leather spine, gilt lettering, top edge gilt, pale blue map endpapers, with accompanying brown slip case, the book is in very good condition and has no markings or annotations within, the slipcase is good but has usual small scuffs and scratches, The Folio Society, London, 2006.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Hardcover. 8vo. Published by The Folio Society Ltd. , 44 Eagle Street, London, UK. 2006. Xxvi, 771 pgs. Illustrated with 27 black and white plates. Issued in slipcase. Slipcase lightly scuffed and worn. Bound in 1/2 leather with silver titles present to the spine and decoration present to the front board. Boards lightly rubbed and worn. No ownership marks present. Text is clean and free of marks, binding tight and solid. The classical historian Theodor Mommsen (18171903) published his History of Rome between 1854 and 1856. His work was received with widespread acclaim by the scholarly community and the reading public. In 1902, in recognition of this monumental work, Mommsen was awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature and acclaimed as 'the greatest living master of the art of historical writing'. Mommsen rejected traditional Enlightenment accounts, which glorified ancient Rome; instead, guided by a new and rigorous criticism of sources, he began the demythologisation of Roman history. In a vivacious and engaging style, using modern terms to express classical ideas, Mommsen drew bold parallels between the nineteenth century and classical Rome. EB; 8vo 8" - 9" tall.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Stated second printing, 2007. A deluxe, hefty Folio Society edition of the famous history of Rome by Germany's Theodor Mommsen (1817-1903). Originally published in three volumes in 1854-56, this single-volume English language version is an abridgment of the three-quarter million-word 1868 edition. The period from Rome's founding through Julius Caesar is covered, to be continued in Mommsen's "The Provinces of the Roman Empire from Caesar to Diocletian," and other works. Translated from the German by W. P. Dickson, introduced by Anthony Grafton and edited by C. J. Shepherd. With numerous black & white illustrations and 17 maps, including at endpapers. --- In royal blue buckram-covered boards backed in brown leather, with image of the she-wolf of Rome suckling Romulus and Remus in gilt to cover; spine titling in gilt. TEG (top edge gilt) and with sewn-in blue satin placemarker. Volume protected in brown paper-covered slipcase. --- An excellent, newish, tightly-bound copy though with a couple of small scratches to spine. Slipcase with minor rubbing, else in great shape. (NOTE: Due to the weight of this item, extra shipping charges may be requested for shipments beyond the U.S.); Tall Octavo - 9 to 10 in. tall; xxvi, 771 pages.
